results.title: Return to the mountains
results.brief_description: Shows Sir Edmund Hillary’s return to the Everest area to establish a school. Illustrates the work of the Sherpa guides, and some aspects of life of the Nepalese. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary.

results.title: Return to the island
results.creator_credit: George Grafton Green, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Irish Tourist Board
results.brief_description: A glimpse of rural Ireland, showing its individual character and tourist features - the beautiful countryside, beaches and coastline; bird sanctuaries; fishing, farming, boating and the Irish horses, and finally a look at Dublin itself.

results.title: Return to the dreaming (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Opus Films and Cecil Holmes
results.brief_description: Yirrawala, a great Aboriginal painter, takes his sons, who have grown up in the white man’s world, back into Arnhem Land in an attempt to find sacred caves and aboriginal art. During the journey, Yirrawala makes a bark painting in the traditional way and he shows us cave paintings never before recorded.

results.title: Return to life: artificial respiration
results.brief_description: A demonstration of four resuscitation methods in the Royal Prince Alfred Hospital, Sydney. A patient is anaesthetized and given an injection of curare, which paralyses the chest muscles and gives the effect of drowning. The Holger-Neilson, hip-lift and Sylvester methods of artificial respiration are then applied in turn, and a spirometer shows an adequate intake of air. The mouth to mouth resuscitation is demonstrated in detail and explained; both the direct contact method and with the use of the insufflator tube.

results.title: Return to Florence
results.brief_description: When Florence flooded in 1966 the oily waters did terrible damage to the art treasures. This program shows the experts from many countries who, under the guidance of UNESCO, continue the slow, painstaking process of restoration. Research and commentary by Rex Keating. Music by Muir Mathieson.

results.title: Return of the sea elephant
results.creator_credit: Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Churchill Films and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
On the island of Guadalupe, 130 miles off the west coast of Mexico, there is a colony of unique aquatic mammals, the nosed sea elephants. On this trip, Cousteau and the crew of the Calypso examine the habits of these unusual animals and try to gather information as to the size of the herd, whether new colonies are forming and where they go in their seven months at sea. With Jacques Cousteau and narrated by Rod Serling.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Churchill Films and Wolper Productions

results.title: Return from the road
results.brief_description: Short film starring US comedian Harvey Korman as a travelling salesman just returned from a long sales trip, tired, hungry and frustrated. With an unco-operative wife who won’t cook and then makes him sleep on the couch, he dreams of what might have been. News of the imminent arrival of his mother-in-law turns his thoughts to the road again.

results.title: Retirement villages: a consumer guide
results.creator_credit: Andrea Philipp, Village Communique and Garry McKechnie
results.brief_description: Buying into a retirement village is a big step and one that leads to further, more complicated issues. This series of 3 videos and booklet attempts to work through these issues and help make the final decision about buying into a retirement village, an informed one. The 3 tapes cover lifestyle, financial and legal issues. The book provides a step by step guide to the process as a whole.
